Suite : default

Feature: Common components on header and footer for homepage, contact us page and Search results page

As an end user I should be able to see common components on header and footer for homepage, contact-us page and Search results page

  • @common-components
  • @javascript
  • @api
  • @anonymous
  • @pre-header

Scenario Outline: As an anonymous user I should be able to see correct text in common pre header region for homepage, contact us page and Search results page

  1. Given I go to "/" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::visit()
  2. Then I should see "Español" in the "preheader" region Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertRegionText()
  3. And I should see "English" in the "preheader" region Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertRegionText()
  4. And I should see "Search" in the "preheader" region Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertRegionText()
  5. And I should see "Log in" in the "preheader" region Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertRegionText()
  6. Given I go to "/en/contact" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::visit()
  7. Then I should see "Español" in the "preheader" region Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertRegionText()
  8. And I should see "English" in the "preheader" region Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertRegionText()
  9. And I should see "Search" in the "preheader" region Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertRegionText()
  10. And I should see "Log in" in the "preheader" region Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertRegionText()
  11. Given I go to "/en/search/node" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::visit()
  12. Then I should see "Español" in the "preheader" region Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertRegionText()
  13. And I should see "English" in the "preheader" region Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertRegionText()
  14. And I should see "Search" in the "preheader" region Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertRegionText()
  15. And I should see "Log in" in the "preheader" region Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertRegionText()

Feature: As an admin I should be able to create,view, edit and delete

article content type and should have proper Validations for all fields

  • @article
  • @api
  • @javascript
  • @authenticated
  • @admin
  • @edit

Scenario: As an admin I should be able to EDIT content of type article

  1. Given I am logged in as a user with the 'administrator' role Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\DrupalContext::assertAuthenticatedByRole()
  2. Then I go to "/en/node/add/article" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::visit()
  3. And I wait for page to load FeatureContext::iWaitForPageToLoad()
  4. And I should see "Create Article" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertPageContainsText()
  5. And I fill in "Title" with "title" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::fillField()
  6. And I fill in wysiwyg on field "Body" with "body text" FeatureContext::iFillInWysiwygOnFieldWith()
  7. And I select "Vegetarian " from "Tags" autocomplete FeatureContext::iSelectFromAutocomplete()
  8. And I press "Add media" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::pressButton()
  9. And I attach the file "ludo.png" to "Add file" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::attachFileToField()
  10. And I wait for "2" seconds FeatureContext::iWaitForSeconds()
  11. And I fill in "Alternative text" with "imagealttext" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::fillField()
  12. And I wait for "1" seconds FeatureContext::iWaitForSeconds()
  13. And I click on "body > div.ui-dialog.ui-corner-all.ui-widget.ui-widget-content.ui-front.media-library-widget-modal.ui-dialog-buttons > div.ui-dialog-buttonpane.ui-widget-content.ui-helper-clearfix > div.ui-dialog-buttonset.form-actions > button" FeatureContext::iClickOn()
  14. And I click on "body > div.ui-dialog.ui-corner-all.ui-widget.ui-widget-content.ui-front.media-library-widget-modal.ui-dialog-buttons > div.ui-dialog-buttonpane.ui-widget-content.ui-helper-clearfix > div.ui-dialog-buttonset.form-actions > button" FeatureContext::iClickOn()
  15. And I select "Published" from "Save as" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::selectOption()
  16. And I press the "Save" button Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::pressButton()
  17. And I should see the success message "Article title has been created." Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MessageContext::assertSuccessMessage()
  18. And I should see "title" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertPageContainsText()
  19. And I should see "body text" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::assertPageContainsText()
  20. Given I go to "/admin/content" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::visit()
  21. And I fill in "title" with "title" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::fillField()
  22. And I press "Filter" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::pressButton()
  23. And I follow "Edit" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::clickLink()
  24. And I fill in "Title" with "Updated title" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::fillField()
  25. When I press the "Save" button Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::pressButton()
  26. Then I should see the success message "Article Updated title has been updated." Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MessageContext::assertSuccessMessage()

  • @delete

Scenario: As an admin I should be able to DELETE content of type article

  14. And I click on "body > div.ui-dialog.ui-corner-all.ui-widget.ui-widget-content.ui-front.media-library-widget-modal.ui-dialog-buttons > div.ui-dialog-buttonpane.ui-widget-content.ui-helper-clearfix > div.ui-dialog-buttonset.form-actions > button" FeatureContext::iClickOn()

  26. When I press "Delete" Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MinkContext::pressButton()
  27. Then I should see the success message "Deleted 1 content item." Drupal\DrupalExtension\Context\MessageContext::assertSuccessMessage()

  • Given I am logged in as a user with the 'administrator' role
  • Then I go to "/en/node/add/article"
  • And I wait for page to load
  • And I should see "Create Article"
  • And I fill in "Title" with "title"
  • And I fill in wysiwyg on field "Body" with "body text"
  • And I select "Vegetarian " from "Tags" autocomplete
  • And I press "Add media"
  • And I attach the file "ludo.png" to "Add file"
  • And I wait for "2" seconds
  • And I fill in "Alternative text" with "imagealttext"
  • And I wait for "1" seconds
  • And I click on "body > div.ui-dialog.ui-corner-all.ui-widget.ui-widget-content.ui-front.media-library-widget-modal.ui-dialog-buttons > div.ui-dialog-buttonpane.ui-widget-content.ui-helper-clearfix > div.ui-dialog-buttonset.form-actions > button"
  • And I click on "body > div.ui-dialog.ui-corner-all.ui-widget.ui-widget-content.ui-front.media-library-widget-modal.ui-dialog-buttons > div.ui-dialog-buttonpane.ui-widget-content.ui-helper-clearfix > div.ui-dialog-buttonset.form-actions > button"
  • And I select "Published" from "Save as"
  • And I press the "Save" button
  • And I should see the success message "Article title has been created."
  • And I should see "title"
  • And I should see "body text"
  • Given I go to "/admin/content"
  • And I fill in "title" with "title"
  • And I press "Filter"
  • And I follow "Edit"
  • And I fill in "Title" with "Updated title"
  • When I press the "Save" button
  • Then I should see the success message "Article Updated title has been updated."
